title: Ciclovia & Cicolruta Programs
description: Reduced crime, improved health & social cohesion

title: Copenhagen Citywide Bicycle Infrastructure
description: 49% of all commutes are by bike, annual savings of $44 million in health costs

title: New York Times Square Pedestrianization
description: 71% increase in retail sales, 40% reduction in pedestrian injuries

title: Mumbai Public Toilet Initiative
description: 1.5 million users. Reduction in sanitation-related illnesses

title: Vienna Active Transportation Campaigns
description: 30% increase in daily walking and cycling trips. Reduction in obesity rates by 5%.

title: Tokyo Urban Greening and Park Development
description: Improved mental health indicators among residents, with a reported 20% reduction in stress levels.

title: New York City Green Cart Initiative
description: Decrease in diet-related illnesses such as diabetes and hypertension.

title: Seoul Health Monitoring Stations
description: Over 1 million users annually. Early detection of chronic illnesses in 15% of users, leading to timely medical intervention.

title: Barcelona Urban Walking Routes
description: 25% increase in daily walking trips. Reduced incidence of heart disease and obesity

title: Amsterdam Smoke-Free Zones in Public Areas
description: Reduced exposure to secondhand smoke for children and decrease in smoking-related litter

title: London Low Emission Zone
description: Decrease in respiratory and cardiovascular hospital admissions by 8%.

title: Built-to-Play - 90 kids-play parks in Southeast Michigan and Western New York
description: 70% of kids observed in play spaces and skate parks were being physically active. 68% of adults observed in play spaces were actively engaged in a social activity, including many elders who valued opportunities to connect.

title: Bujairi Terrace
description: Renovation and investment in historical bujairi is expected to receive 7 million tourists annually.

title: The Cultural Quarter of Zorlu Center
description: The Zorlu Performing Arts Center hosts over 200 performances annually, attracting both local and international audiences. Regular exhibitions and cultural events enrich Istanbul's cultural scene. The center has created thousands of jobs in retail, hospitality, and cultural sectors.

title: The Regeneration of the Gothic Quarter
description: Numerous historic buildings have been restored, maintaining the architectural heritage. Increase in the number of cultural institutions and art galleries. Hosting numerous cultural festivals and public events, boosting local engagement. Significant increase in local businesses, including shops, restaurants, and cultural enterprises. Restoration projects have led to a rise in property values and investment.

title: The Preservation of the Old Town, Tallinn
description: Numerous buildings have been restored to their historical appearance. Increased public awareness and education about heritage preservation. Significant contribution to the local economy from tourism. Increase in the number and quality of museums and cultural centers. 1.29 million annual tourists.

title: Rotterdam Afrikaanderwijk Cooperative
description: Created over 50 jobs for local residents. Generated $1.5 million in local revenue. Increased social cohesion by increasing diversity in neighborhoods.

title: The Tech Industry Boom in Bengaluru
description: Funding for infrastructure and development came from a mix of state and central government budgets, private sector investments, and international partnerships. Incentives and tax breaks were offered to attract IT companies. Contribution of IT exports to India's GDP, with Bengaluru accounting for over 30% of the country's software exports. Employment of over 1.5 million people directly in the tech sector and additional jobs in related industries.

title: The Economic Revitalization of Pittsburgh
description: Significant growth in healthcare and education sectors, with UPMC becoming one of the largest employers. Emergence of a robust tech sector, with companies like Google and Uber establishing a presence. Conversion of former industrial sites into commercial and residential areas. Development of cultural districts and recreational spaces to enhance urban living.

title: Riyadh's economic bloom
description: Strong investments towards digitilization and non-oil investments. Contributing to 50% of the country's non-oil investments.

title: The High Line in New York City
description: Significant increase in property values in the neighborhoods adjacent to the High Line. Attracted millions of visitors annually, boosting local businesses and tourism. Encouraged new residential and commercial developments along the High Line corridor.

title: Community Learning Centers in New Delhi
description: Increase in Enrollment 20% increase in school enrollment rates within the communities served. Improved Academic Performance Students attending CLCs showed a 15% improvement in their standardized test scores. Approximately $1,000 per center annually, funded through local NGOs and community contributions.

title: Education Superhighway in San Francisco
description: Providing affordable high-speed internet to underserved public schools. Internet access in schools improved by 50%. 70% of teachers reported increased use of digital learning tools.

title: School Feeding Programs in Lagos
description: Implementation of a school feeding program to provide free meals to students. 25% increase in school enrollment. 30% reduction in absenteeism. $0.25 per meal, funded by government and international aid agencies.

title: Edible Schoolyards in Berkeley
description: Creating garden-based learning programs in schools. Students involved in garden programs scored 12% higher in science. 40% of students reported increased knowledge of nutrition. Initial setup cost of $2,500 per garden, with ongoing costs covered by local fundraising.

title: Bridge Schools in Nairobi
description: Establishing low-cost private schools using a standardized curriculum and technology. Students scored 10-20% higher in reading and math compared to peers in public schools. $6 per month per student, making it affordable for low-income families. Rapid expansion with over 50,000 students enrolled within three years.

title: Cheonggyecheon Stream Restoration
description: 35% reduction in pollution, 50% increase in property value.

title: Paris, Vélib' Bike Share Program
description: 100,000 daily rides. 32,330 tons of CO2 emissions saved annually.

title: London Pocket Parks Program (Green Spaces)
description: 100 pocket parks created. Increased local property values by up to 8%.

title: Barcelona Superblocks Initiative
description: 20% reduction in NO2 levels within superblocks. Increased public space per resident from 1.85 m to 6.65 m. 5-10 decibel decrease in noise pollution. 30% increase interaction among residents.

title: Medellín's Green Corridors
description: Temperature drops of up to 2°C in some areas. Airborne particulate matter (PM10) levels have decreased by around 7%. Social, economic, and cultural impacts observed.

title: Cape Town Violence Prevention Through Urban Upgrading
description: 25-40% decrease in violent crime and 85% increase in community involvement.

title: Medellín’s Social Urbanism
description: Significant reduction in crime rates due to improved social conditions and accessibility. Development of innovative transport solutions like the Metrocable, connecting underserved areas to the city center. Creation of library parks and public spaces to foster community engagement. Increased local and international investments in Medellín. Creation of jobs through construction projects and improved business environments.

title: The Harlem Children's Zone
description: Decrease in youth violence and crime rates in the targeted areas. Improved safety through community engagement and support programs. High school graduation rates increased significantly among program participants. Increased college enrollment rates for students involved in HCZ programs.

title: Camden's Community Policing and Violence Prevention
description: 42% reduction in homicides from 2012 to 2019. Increased police presence and engagement with community members through foot patrols and local meetings. Programs targeting at-risk youth, including mentorship and recreational activities. Provision of social services, such as job training and educational support.

title: Richmond's Office of Neighborhood Safety
description: 66% reduction in homicides from 2007 to 2018. Engagement with at-risk youth through mentorship programs and personal development plans. Provision of job training, education, and employment opportunities for participants.

title: Atlanta's Beltline
description: 5,600 new workforce housing units. 50,000 new housing units anticipated along the corridor. 45 neighborhoods gain new and greater connectivity. 8 percent of the city's land mass covered in the planning area and 25 percent of Atlanta's residential population.

title: Toronto, Regent Park Revitalization
description: 5,400 new units, including affordable and market-rate housing. Increased social mix and community engagement through shared public spaces.

title: Vienna's Social Housing Model
description: Rents in Vienna's social housing are approximately 20-30% lower than the private market. Only about 25% of household income is spent on rent, compared to higher percentages in many other cities. Social and economic impacts observed by promoting diverse neighborhoods.

title: Tokyo's Small-Space Affordable Housing
description: Small-space units typically rent for 20-40% less than standard apartments. Rapid development of small-space units has helped alleviate housing shortages. Small-space housing increases population density without expanding the city's footprint.

title: Freiburg's Vauban District
description: Environmental impacts include; all buildings in Vauban are constructed to high energy efficiency standards, with many meeting the Passivhaus standard. The district generates a significant portion of its energy through renewable sources, including solar power. Approximately 30% of the housing is cooperatively owned, significantly reducing costs and all housing is affordable. Social impacts included recruiting residents in the design and planning as well as ensuring diversity in residents.

title: Medellín, Colombia Metrocable
description: 300,000 passengers daily, 60% time decrease in travel time to city center

title: Curitiba Bus Rapid Transit System
description: 2 million passengers daily. $1.5 million per kilometer, compared to $100 million per kilometer for subway system

title: Riyadh public transportation
description: Cost $22 billion, 9 million users expected users by 2028. Average revenue per user is expected to be 99.25 dollars. Capacity for about 1 million users daily (metro only not including buses)

title: Copenhagen Citywide Bicycle Infrastructure
description: 49% of all commutes are by bike, annual savings of $44 million in health costs

title: Vienna Active Transportation Campaigns
description: 30% increase in daily walking and cycling trips. Reduction in obesity rates by 5%.

title: Numerous cities Integrating Refugees through Sports
description: 1,000 refugees engaged in sports programs. 70% of participants reported feeling more connected to their community.

title: Singapore Community-in-Bloom Program
description: 1,200 community gardens with over 20,000 gardeners. Improved neighbor relations and increased community activities.

title: Melbourne Laneway Revitalization
description: 20 laneways revitalized. Increased foot traffic and social interactions by 35%.

title: Paris Les Grands Voisins
description: Hosted 2,000 events, attracting over 100,000 visitors annually. Provided temporary housing for 600 people.

title: Medellín Biblioteca España
description: Construction of a large library and cultural center in a marginalized neighborhood to provide educational resources and cultural activities. 1,500 daily visitors. Increased literacy rates and community engagement in cultural activities.

title: Berlin Neighborhood Mothers (Stadtteilmütter)
description: 200 Neighborhood Mothers supporting over 1,000 families annually. Increased school participation rates and improved health service utilization among immigrant families.

title: Millennium Park, Chicago
description: The development of Millennium Park has transformed an old rail yard into a major public park, fostering social cohesion through cultural events, public art, and recreational spaces. 25 million visitors annually. $1.4 billion in tourism revenue generated.

title: HafenCity, Hamburg
description: The redevelopment of Hamburg's old port into a mixed-use urban quarter has focused on creating diverse, inclusive communities with ample public spaces for social activities. 14,000 new jobs created. 6,000 new residents.

title: Bryant Park New York City
description: The transformation of Bryant Park from a neglected space to a vibrant urban park has significantly increased social cohesion through programming and public events. 12 million visitors annually. Hosts over 1,000 free activities per year.

title: Malmö City Library International Programs
description: The library offers a range of programs and services aimed at integrating immigrants, including language cafes, cultural events, and information services on local customs and laws. 50,000 attendees at language cafes and cultural events annually. 90% of participants report feeling more integrated into the community.

title: Toronto Newcomer Office
description: This office coordinates a range of services for immigrants, including employment support, language training, and cultural orientation, fostering social cohesion and reducing discrimination. 100,000 newcomers assisted annually. 80% of participants find employment within a year of participating in the programs.
